mods.abstract: Hypostyle Hall, Temple of Hathor at Dendereh (Ptolemaic-Roman Periods); three monumental columns with rows of papyrus, ankhs, winged uraei wearing atef crowns, cartouches, and other Egyptian motifs; two Egyptian boys demonstrated vast size by attempting to wrap outstretched arms around base of column; "No. 1012 Dendereh Phot. Art. G. Lekegian & Co." in white along bottom of print. (Number on object is 5/698).

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
